title: Yolanda Silvia Santiago Ayala (0000-0003-2516-0871) - ORCID | Connecting Research and Researchers

biography.value:
Yolanda Silvia Santiago Ayala is a Peruvian mathematician who Works in Partial Differential Equations, Functional Analysis and Applied Mathematics.
Born in Lima, Peru. Yolanda is the daughter of Guillermo and Rosa. She has two daughters, Silvia and Bianca. 
Yolanda received her Ph.D from the Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro in 2002 under the supervision of Jaime Rivera. She received her Master from the IMPA in 1995.
She is currently a Principal Professor at the Universidad Nacional Mayor de San Marcos (UNMSM). She is a researcher at the UNMSM, Titular Member and Coordinator of the Research Group: Group of Differential Equations, Analysis and Applications-GEDAAp of the UNMSM.
She is member of the Brazilian Mathematical Society (1993), College of Mathematician of Peru (1997), Peruvian Mathematical Society (2002), Royal Spanish Mathematical Society (2020) and the Organization for Women in Science for the Developing World (2020).
